PATIENT_ID: TEST_DVT_PEDS_001
ARRIVAL_TIME: 2026-02-12 10:00:00

[TRAUMA_HP] 2026-02-12 10:10:00
Category I trauma activation for 14-year-old male. Pedestrian struck by vehicle.
Trauma admission confirmed. Age 14.
Right femur fracture and left tibia fracture. Long-bone fracture confirmed.
BP 100/65, HR 120, RR 22, GCS 15.
Obesity documented: BMI 32. Central venous catheter placed for resuscitation.
DVT risk factor assessment: obesity and central venous catheter present.
No active bleeding. Bleeding status: controlled post-reduction.
No intracranial hemorrhage.

[NURSING_NOTE] 2026-02-12 10:30:00
Admitted to PICU. Length of stay anticipated > 24 hours. Admitted.
Pubertal status: Tanner stage 4. Weight 95 kg.

[PHYSICIAN_NOTE] 2026-02-12 22:00:00
DVT risk factors documented: obesity, prolonged bedrest, central venous catheter.
Chemical DVT prophylaxis ordered. Enoxaparin initiated weight-based dosing.
No contraindications identified.
